input.description: Virtual machine whose guest operating system needs to be customized.

Network identity and settings, similar to Microsoft's Sysprep tool. This is a Sysprep, LinuxPrep, or SysprepText object.
Valid Values: CustomizationLinuxPrep, CustomizationSysprep.

The XML input is as follows
<password> <value>aaa</value> <plain-text>true</plain-text> </password>
The new administrator password for the machine.
password: The new administrator password for the machine value: The password string. It is encrypted if the associated plainText flag is false. plain-text: Flag to specify whether or not the password is in plain text, rather than encrypted. (valid values true and false)
Note: Valid (but optional) only when "identity type" is "CustomizationSysprep".

The time zone for the new virtual machine. Numbers correspond to time zones listed in sysprep documentation in Microsoft Technet.
Valid value: int
Note: Valid (and Mandatory) only when "identity type" is "CustomizationSysprep".

Flag to determine whether or not the machine automatically logs on as Administrator. See also the password property.
Valid Value: Boolean
Note: Valid (and Mandatory) only when "identity type" is "CustomizationSysprep".

If the AutoLogon flag is set, then the AutoLogonCount property specifies the number of times the machine should automatically log on as Administrator. Generally it should be 1, but if your setup requires a number of reboots, you may want to increase it. This number may be determined by the list of commands executed by the GuiRunOnce command.
Valid value: int
Note: Valid (and Mandatory) only when identity type is "CustomizationSysPrep"

User's full name.
Valid value: String
Note: Valid (and Mandatory) only when identity type is "CustomizationSysprep"

User's organization.
Valid value: String
Note: Valid (and Mandatory) only when identity type is "CustomizationSysprep"

The computer name of the (Windows) virtual machine.
Valid value: <computer-name> <name></name> </computer-name>
Note: Valid (and Mandatory) only when identity type is "CustomizationSysprep"

Microsoft Sysprep requires that a valid serial number be included in the answer file when mini-setup runs. This serial number is ignored if the original guest operating system was installed using a volume-licensed CD.
Valid value: String
Note: Valid (and Mandatory) only when identity type is "CustomizationSysprep"

A list of commands to run at first user logon, after guest customization.
XML Format:
<gui-run-once> <!-- one or more--> <command></command> <command></command> </gui-run-once>
Note: Valid (but Optional) only when the identity type if "CustomizationSysprep"

The workgroup that the virtual machine should join. If this value is supplied, then the domain name and authentication fields must be empty.
Valid value: String
Note: Valid (but Optional) only when the identity type if "CustomizationSysprep"

The domain that the virtual machine should join. If this value is supplied, then domainAdmin and domainAdminPassword must also be supplied, and the workgroup name must be empty
Note: Valid (but Optional) only when the identity type if "CustomizationSysprep"

This is the domain user account used for authentication if the virtual machine is joining a domain. The user does not need to be a domain administrator, but the account must have the privileges required to add computers to the domain.
Note: Valid (but Optional) only when the identity type if "CustomizationSysprep"

This is the password for the domain user account used for authentication if the virtual machine is joining a domain.
XML Format:
<domain-admin-password> <value></value> <plain-text></plain-text> </domain-admin-password>
Note: Valid (but Optional) only when the identity type if "CustomizationSysprep"

Server licensing mode.
Valid value: perSeat, perServer
Note: Valid only when the identity type if "CustomizationSysprep"
Further Note that The "license file print data auto mode" and "license file print data auto user" are passed in the following format:
<license-file-print-data> <auto-mode>?</auto-mode> <auto-users>?</auto-users> </license-file-print-data>
The <license-file-print-data> element is optional, but if it is specified, the <auto-mode> element becomes mandatory.
input.from: license file print data auto mode
input.to: license file print data auto mode

input.description:
This key is valid only if AutoMode = PerServer. The integer value indicates the number of client licenses purchased for the VirtualCenter server being installed.
Valid value: int
Note: Valid (but Optional) only when the identity type if "CustomizationSysprep"
input.from: license file print data auto user
input.to: license file print data auto user

input.description:
The computer name of the (Non-Windows) virtual machine.
Valid value: <host-name> <name></name> </host-name>
Note: Valid (and Mandatory) only when identity type is "CustomizationLinuxPrep"

The fully qualified domain name.
Valid value: String
Note: Valid (and Mandatory) only when identity type is "CustomizationLinuxPrep"

List of name resolution suffixes for the virtual network adapter. This list applies to both Windows and Linux guest customization. For Linux, this setting is global, whereas in Windows, this setting is listed on a per-adapter basis, even though the setting is global in Windows.
Valid value: <dns-suffix-list> <dns-suffix-list></dns-suffix-list> <dns-suffix-list></dns-suffix-list> </dns-suffix-list>

List of DNS servers, for a virtual network adapter with a static IP address. If this list is empty, then the guest operating system is expected to use a DHCP server to get its DNS server settings. These settings configure the virtual machine to use the specified DNS servers. These DNS server settings are listed in order of preference. If you supply this list, be sure to specify that dnsFromDhcp is false.
Valid value: <dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> </dns-server-list>

Specification to obtain a unique IP address for this virtual network adapter.
ip type: CustomizationDhcpIpGenerator, CustomizationFixedIp
Valid value: <ip type=""> <ipAddress></ipAddress> </ip>

Subnet mask for this virtual network adapter.
Valid value: String

For a virtual network adapter with a static IP address, this data object type contains a list of gateways, in order of preference.
Valid value: String

A list of server IP addresses to use for DNS lookup in a Windows guest operating system. In Windows, these settings are adapter-specific, whereas in Linux, they are global. As a result, the Linux guest customization process ignores this setting and looks for its DNS servers in the globalIPSettings object. Specify these servers in order of preference. If this list is not empty, and if a DHCP IpGenerator is used, then these settings override the DHCP settings.
Valid XML Format: <dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> </dns-server-list>

A DNS domain suffix such as vmware.com.
Valid value: String
The IP address of the primary WINS server. This property is ignored for Linux guest operating systems.
The IP address of the secondary WINS server. This property is ignored for Linux guest operating systems.

NIC Setting map list [optional] Set of Network Adapters to be customized.
Value takes the form:
<nic-setting-map-list> <!--Zero or more repetitions:--> <nic-setting-map> <adapter> <ip type="?"> <ipAddress>?</ipAddress> </ip> <subnet-mask>?</subnet-mask> <gateway>?</gateway> <dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> <dns-server-list></dns-server-list> </dns-server-list> <dns-domain>?</dns-domain> <primary-wins>?</primary-wins> <secondary-wins>?</secondary-wins> </adapter> </nic-setting-map> </nic-setting-map-list>
Valid values for IP type attribute:
CustomizationFixedIp CustomizationDhcpIpGenerator
Note: <ipAddress> is valid only when the value for <ip type> is CustomizationFixedIp.
Note:
The <ip>, <subnet-mask>, <gateway>, <dns-server-list>, <dns-domain>, <primaryWINS> and <secondaryWINS> elements are children of the <nic-setting-map> element. To add a single network adapter element (<nic-setting-map>), fill in the values in the above four elements. To add multiple netwrok adapters (multiple <nic-setting-map>), use the <nic-setting-map-list> element.
If <nic-setting-map-list> is provided, the same is added to the customization XML, if <nic-setting-map-list> is not provided and any of the <ip>, <subnet-mask>, <gateway>, <dns-server-list>, <dns-domain>, <primaryWINS> and <secondaryWINS> elements is not null, then a single <nic-setting-map> is added to the customization XML.
If both are provided then only the <nic-setting-map-list> element is added.
Further note that the <nic-setting-map-list> element can be used to define a single netwrok adapter also.
